etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Henry Roscoe (1833–1915), chemist and university administrator. From menth- + -one, perhaps after menthene

definitions: A cyclic ketone which is an oily liquid with an odour of peppermint, occurring in peppermint, geranium, and other essential oils; 2-isopropyl-5-methylcyclohexanone, C₁₀ H₁₈ O.
